input_text: Lɔkaci nga di kuna no coobaaba-ize yom di kaa Yesu dɔ ka cii: «Mee ya beeri nda bɔrɔ kulu bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ kuna?»Cɔfɔ Yesu na koo cɛna fɔ cɛɛ nga dɔ ka à dam ngei bindi kuna.À cii: «Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, de wom mana bɛrɛ ka ye zanga koo cɛna yom, wom si huro bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ kunaNga di sɛ, bɔrɔ kulu ka à ga nga bɔm-yeeti-ganda zanga koo cɛna wɔ, akpɛ ya beeri nda bɔrɔ kulu bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ kuna.Bɔrɔ kulu mo ka à go koo cɛna fɔ zanga wɔne ta a maa gaa, akpɛ go ka a ta.Amma bɔrɔ kulu ka à koo cɛna yom wɔ ka ǹ go naane a gaa ǹ ŋmɔne afɔ dɛrandi ǹ ma fufuyom tondi hɔ akpɛ jinde gaa. Ǹ ma à cetu buula nungu guusɔ kuna, à bisa.Kaito handunya, dɛrɛyom sabu sɛ. Tilasi no dɛrɛyom ma kaa, amma kaito, bɔrɔ ka à dɔ dɛrandiyom kaa.De bine, n kambɛ wala n cee ya tɛ n dɛrandikɔ, n ma à dumbu ka cetu à ma mooru ni. N ma huro hundi kuna nda cee fɔ wala leebantɛ à bisa, n ma gunda kambɛ hinka wala cee hinka ǹ ma n cetu nini ka à sinda beeniyom kuna.De n moo ya tɛ n dɛrandikɔ, ǹ ma à kaa ka cetu à ma mooru ni. N ma huro hundi kuna nda moo fɔ à bisa, n ma gunda moo hinka ǹ ma n cetu Gehɛnna nini kuna.»«Wom ma laakali ka si donda koo cɛna yom wɔ ǹ ŋmɔne afɔ. A go cii wom sɛ, bɛɛnɛ kuna ǹ ŋmɔne maleeka yom go di a Baaba ka à goono bɛɛnɛ mooduma saa kulu.Domi Adam-ize kaa no, ka hɛ ka à dɛrɛ faaba.Mɛtɛ no à hima wom sɛ? Zanga sendi, bɔrɔ fɔ gunda feeji zangu (100). Cɔfɔ ǹ ŋmɔne afɔ dɛrɛ. À na ci à zangu-afɔ-si (99) di nam no, ka kpei tondi-kuuku yom bɔm ka feeji ka à dɛrɛ di ceeci?De à dià, cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, à go farihã nda nga di ka bisa zangu-afɔ-si (99) di ka ǹ mana dɛrɛ.Ya no à mana ci wom Baaba ka à goono bɛɛnɛ bine-baa, koo yom wɔ ŋmɔne afɔ ma halaci.»«De n nya-ize na dulum tɛ n sɛ, n ma kpei ka à kɔnkɔm, ni nda à hinne game. De à na hanga dam n sɛ, nya-izetɛrɛ gɔrɔ noya.Amma de à si hanga dam n sɛ, n ma bɔrɔ fɔ wala ihinka zaa n banda. Sɛɛda hinka wala ihinza sendi ga asiiri kulu gɔrɛndi.De bine à si baa nga ma hanga dam ǹ sɛ, n ma à cii mariga bɔrɔ yom sɛ. Bine de à si baa nga ma hanga dam mariga bɔrɔ yom mo sɛ, nya-ize nga di ma tɛ n sɛ zanga dimi-cindei, zanga alikaasi takɔ.Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, hɛ kulu ka wom go hɔ ganda wɔ bɔm ǹ ga à hɔ bɛɛnɛ kuna. Hɛ kulu mo ka wom go feeri ganda wɔ bɔm, ǹ ga à feeri bɛɛnɛ mo.Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ kpɛɛnɛ ka de wom kuna bɔrɔ hinka na hɛ fɔlɔnku tu ganda wɔ bɔm, hɛ kulu ka ǹ kaa ŋmaarɛ, a Baaba ka à goono bɛɛnɛ ga à tɛ ǹ sɛ.Nungu kulu ka bɔrɔ hinka wala bɔrɔ hinza meigu a maa gaa, a goono ǹ bindi kuna.»Cɔfɔ Piɛɛ maani à dɔ ka cii: «Kpe, ce mɛijɛ no ya a nya-ize yaafa saa ka à na dulum tɛ a sɛ? Hali ce iye?»Yesu cii à sɛ: «Ya na cii n sɛ hali ce iye, amma ce weiye hali ce iye.À sɛ no bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ hima zanga gandakpɛ fɔ ka à go baa nga ma nga nooru yom ka ǹ goono à tam yom dɔ kabu.Saa ka à sinti kabuyom di, ǹ kaanda à sɛ banyã fɔ ka talã dubu-wei (10.000) goono à dɔ.Ka banyã di sinda hɛ ka à ma bana, à kpe di na fɔndɔ no ǹ ma à neera. À ma à neera nda à wɛndɛ nda à koo yom nda hɛ kulu ka à gunda hali banandi ma tɛ.Cɔfɔ banyã di sɔmbu à jine. À ŋmaarɛ ka cii: ‹Kpe, hini suuru, a ga à kulu bana n sɛ.›Sisibi na banyã di kpɛa dii. À na banyã di tam ka garɔ di yaafa à sɛ.Amma saa ka banyã di hunu nungu di, à kube nda nga kpaasi banyã yom ŋmɔne afɔ ka à dinari zangu (100) goono à gaa. Cɔfɔ à na à dii ka kɔɔtɛ. À cii à sɛ: ‹A bana a nooru ka à goono n gaa.›À kpaasi banyã di sɔmbu à jine. À ŋmaarɛ ka cii: ‹Suuru tɛ a sɛ. A ga ǹ kulu bana n sɛ.›Amma à hungu ka suuru tɛ à sɛ. À kpeindaà ka dam kasu kala à ma garɔ di bana.Amma ka à kpaasi banyã cindei di hɛ ka à tɛ, ǹ bine sara kala-kala. Ǹ kpei cii ngei kpɛa sɛ hɛ ka à tɛ.Kpɛa na à cɛɛ nga dɔ ka cii: ‹Banyã laalɔ, a na garɔ wɔ kulu yaafa n sɛ, zama n na a ŋmaarɛ suuru sɛ.À hima sisibi ma n dii n kpaasi banyã sɛ zanga hɛɛ wɔ, sisibi na a dii n sɛ.›À kpɛa bine tɔ. À na banyã di dam bɔnandikɔ yom kambɛ kala saa ka à kaa garɔ di kulu bana.Ya no a Baaba ka à goono bɛɛnɛ, à kaa tɛ wom sɛ de wom kuna afɔ-fɔ kulu si nga nya-ize yaafa nda bine-fɔ.»
target_text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”He called a little child and had him stand among them.And he said: “I tell you the truth, unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.Therefore, whoever humbles himself like this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.“And whoever welcomes a little child like this in my name welcomes me.But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a large millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.“Woe to the world because of the things that cause people to sin! Such things must come, but woe to the man through whom they come!If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life maimed or crippled than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into eternal fire.And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.“See that you do not look down on one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father in heaven.“What do you think? If a man owns a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go to look for the one that wandered off?And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he is happier about that one sheep than about the ninety-nine that did not wander off.In the same way your Father in heaven is not willing that any of these little ones should be lost.“If your brother sins against you, go and show him his fault, just between the two of you. If he listens to you, you have won your brother over.But if he will not listen, take one or two others along, so that ‘every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.’If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, treat him as you would a pagan or a tax collector.“I tell you the truth, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.“Again, I tell you that if two of you on earth agree about anything you ask for, it will be done for you by my Father in heaven.For where two or three come together in my name, there am I with them.”Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, “Lord, how many times shall I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to seven times?”Jesus answered, “I tell you, not seven times, but seventy-seven times.“Therefore, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.As he began the settlement, a man who owed him ten thousand talents was brought to him.Since he was not able to pay, the master ordered that he and his wife and his children and all that he had be sold to repay the debt.“The servant fell on his knees before him. ‘Be patient with me,’ he begged, ‘and I will pay back everything.’The servant's master took pity on him, canceled the debt and let him go.“But when that servant went out, he found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii. He grabbed him and began to choke him. ‘Pay back what you owe me!’ he demanded.“His fellow servant fell to his knees and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you back.’“But he refused. Instead, he went off and had the man thrown into prison until he could pay the debt.When the other servants saw what had happened, they were greatly distressed and went and told their master everything that had happened.“Then the master called the servant in. ‘You wicked servant,’ he said, ‘I canceled all that debt of yours because you begged me to.Shouldn't you have had mercy on your fellow servant just as I had on you?’In anger his master turned him over to the jailers to be tortured, until he should pay back all he owed.“This is how my heavenly Father will treat each of you unless you forgive your brother from your heart.”
new_anglais: At that time of the elders came to Jesus in Jerusalem, “This is written by the people.”When Jesus said to the chief priests and the law, “This is not do, but they do not do you, but you say, ‘It is not do not do not be left on the seed.’“It is not do you, the prophet to be seen to death.“In the Sabbath and the Sabbath for them.”When Jesus was not be born in my name, he was not be afraid.“I know that you know what is not to the temple,

input_text: À kaa tɔ saa ka Yesu na nga mecine yom tɛ ka beeni, à banda no à tunu za Galile laabu ka kpei Yude laabu hali Yurudɛ͂ isa bisantɛ.Bɔrɔ bakara na à gana. Nungu di mo à na doorikɔm yom no baani.Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom mo kaa à dɔ ka à sui. Ǹ cii: «À halali bɔrɔ ma nga wɛndɛ fee sababu kulu ka à sɛ no?»Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Wom na Ikpɛ Senda coo ba ka à cii sintine gaa ‹Takakɔ na ǹ tɛ harubɔrɔ nda weibɔrɔ›?À cii: ‹À sɛ no harubɔrɔ ga nga nya nda nga baaba nam ka hɔ nga wei gaa. Ǹ bɔrɔ hinka di, ǹ kaa tɛ gaaham fɔlɔnku.›Zanga ya no ǹ si tɛ ihinka kpɛɛnɛ amma gaaham fɔlɔnku. Nga di sɛ no, hɛ ka Ikpɛ hɔ cɛrɛ gaa bɔrɔ ma si à fee.»Cɔfɔ ǹ cii à sɛ: «Ifɔ sɛ no Moisi na mei no ǹ ma hiije wiyom tira no ka du ka wɛndɛ fee?»Yesu mo cii ǹ sɛ: «Wom bine-sɛnda sabu sɛ no Moisi tu ka wom ma wom wɛndɛ yom fee. Amma za sintine à na ci ya di.A go cii wom sɛ mo, bɔrɔ kulu ka à ga nga wɛndɛ fee, de à mana ci zina sabu sɛ, ka afɔ ŋmaani hiiji akpɛ go zina. Bɔrɔ ka à na weibɔrɔ ka à fee hiiji, akpɛ go zina.»À coobaaba-ize yom mo cii à sɛ: «De ya no kunye nda wɛndɛ game à si hima bɔrɔ ma hiiji.»Amma Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Bɔrɔ kulu si hini ka sendi wɔne ta amma kala beerem ka ǹ sɛ ǹ go ka à no.Beerem goono ka ǹ harubɔrɔtɛrɛ bu. Ya no ǹ na ǹ hɛi za ǹ nya yom gunde kuna. Beerem goono mo ka adam-ize yom ya na ǹ harubɔrɔtɛrɛ wi. Beerem goono ka ǹ na ngei bɔm tɛ zanga bɔrɔ mantam yom bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ sabu sɛ. Bɔrɔ ka à hini ka à ta, à ma à ta.»Ǹ kaanda Yesu sɛ koo cɛna yom zama à ma kambɛ dɛcɛ ǹ bɔm ka aduwa tɛ ǹ sɛ. Amma coobaaba-ize yom di go kaandakɔ yom yaaya.Amma Yesu cii: «Wa nam koo cɛna yom ma kaa a dɔ. Wa si ǹ ganji, zama beerem zanga koo cɛna yom wɔ, ǹ ŋmɔne no bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ.»À na kambɛ dɛcɛ ǹ bɔm, cɔfɔ à gana noodi.Cɔfɔ bɔrɔ fɔ maani Yesu dɔ ka cii à sɛ: «Coobaaba hinnɔ, hɛ hinnɔ fɔ no ya tɛ ka du hundi ka à si beeni?»Yesu cii à sɛ: «Ifɔ sɛ n go ka a cɛɛ ihinnɔ? Bɔrɔ si ka à ci ihinnɔ kala Bɔrɔ fɔlɔnku. Nga ya ci Ikpɛ. Amma de n go baa n ma huro hundi ka à si beeni kuna, kala n ma meire yom gana.»Bɔrɔ di cii à sɛ: «Wɔ fɔ yom?» Yesu cii à sɛ: «N ma si bɔrɔ wi. N ma si zina. N ma si zee. N ma si tɛ tangari sɛɛda.N ma bɛɛrɛ tɛ n nya nda n baaba sɛ. N ma baa n gɔrɔkasine zanga n bɔm.»Haruwasu di cii à sɛ: «A na nge yom di kulu gana za a goono haruwasu-ize. Ifɔ ya gazia a sɛ kpɛɛnɛ?»Yesu cii à sɛ: «De n go baa n ma ci tɔantɛ, n ma kpei hɛ kulu ka n gunda neera ka noora farisi talika yom sɛ. N kaa du harizici jisandi bɛɛnɛ kuna. N ma kaa ka a gana mo.»Ka haruwasu di maa sendi nga di cɔfɔ à dira nda binesɛrɛ, zama haribarika no à gunda hali ǹ ci mɔsɔ.Yesu bine cii nga coobaaba-ize yom sɛ: «Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, à gaabu fa haribarikantɛ ma huro bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ kuna.A go cii wom sɛ mo kpɛɛnɛ ka à faala yoo sɛ à ma bisa sana fune kuna nda haribarikantɛ ma huro Ikpɛ kpetɛrɛ kuna.»Ka à coobaaba-ize yom maa nga di, maamaaci na ǹ dii kala-kala. Ǹ cii: «Dee, mee ya hini ka du faaba da?»Amma Yesu na ǹ guna ka cii: «Adam-ize yom dɔ nga di si hini ka tɛ, amma Ikpɛ dɔ hɛ kulu hini ka tɛ.»Piɛɛ mo tu à sɛ ka cii: «Guna, i na hɛ kulu nam ka n gana, hɛ fɔ iyom wɔ i kaa du da?»Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, hɛ kulu tejandiyom gaa, Adam-ize kaa gɔrɔ nga kpetɛrɛ-kariga deiza-kpɛ bɔm. Saa nga di, wom ka wom na a gana, wom kaa gɔrɔ kariga wei-cindi-hinka (12) bɔm ka ciiti Isiraila kunda wei-cindi-hinka (12) sɛ.Bɔrɔ kulu mo ka à na fuu yom nam, wala nga cɛɛnɛ yom, nda nga bɛɛrɛ yom, wala weima yom, wala nya, wala baaba, wala wɛndɛ, wala koo yom, wala fari yom a maa sabu sɛ, akpɛ kaa duà cine zangu (100). À kaa hundi ka à si beeni mo tubu.Amma sintine bɔrɔ boobo kaa ci kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom. Kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom mo kaa ci sintine bɔrɔ yom.»
target_text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went into the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan.Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.Some Pharisees came to him to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any and every reason?”“Haven't you read,” he replied, “that at the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?So they are no longer two, but one. Therefore what God has joined together, let man not separate.”“Why then,” they asked, “did Moses command that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?”Jesus replied, “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard. But it was not this way from the beginning.I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, and marries another woman commits adultery.”The disciples said to him, “If this is the situation between a husband and wife, it is better not to marry.”Jesus replied, “Not everyone can accept this word, but only those to whom it has been given.For some are eunuchs because they were born that way; others were made that way by men; and others have renounced marriage because of the kingdom of heaven. The one who can accept this should accept it.”Then little children were brought to Jesus for him to place his hands on them and pray for them. But the disciples rebuked those who brought them.Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”When he had placed his hands on them, he went on from there.Now a man came up to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to get eternal life?”“Why do you ask me about what is good?” Jesus replied. “There is only One who is good. If you want to enter life, obey the commandments.”“Which ones?” the man inquired. Jesus replied, “ ‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony,honor your father and mother,’ and ‘love your neighbor as yourself.’ ”“All these I have kept,” the young man said. “What do I still lack?”Jesus answered, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”When the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had great wealth.Then Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, “Who then can be saved?”Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”Peter answered him, “We have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?”Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, at the renewal of all things, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.
new_anglais: When Jesus had been to him, he said to the sky, he said to the people, he said to the disciples, “When you can what they do, do not do what you do, but they do not do, but you know what do, but they will be afraid.He went on a man. But do not do not do not do you them. For they will be afraid, and they will be afraid, but they will be afraid to him. I know that you see

input_text: Ǹ na Yesu hɛi Bɛtɛlɛhɛm kpaara Yude laabu gandakpɛ Hirodu kpetɛrɛ waatɛ. Cɔfɔ beirekpɛ yom hunu za weenuhune ka kaa Yerusalɛm wangara.Ǹ cii: «Mani Yuifu yom gandakpɛ di ka ǹ hɛi goono? I di à handariya-ize weenuhune hɛrɛ. I kaa ka à bɛɛrandi no.»Amma ka gandakpɛ Hirodu maa nga di, baaru di na à butugu, nga nda Yerusalɛm kulu.Cɔfɔ à na jama ŋmɔne garandikɔ jina yom nda à ŋmɔne Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom meigu ka ǹ hã nungu ka à hima ǹ ma Mɛsiya hɛi.Ǹ cii à sɛ: «Bɛtɛlɛhɛm kpaara Yude laabu, zama andebi na wɔne hantum ka cii:‹Ni bine Bɛtɛlɛhɛm, Yude laabu N mana ci Yude kpaara beeri yom ŋmɔne icɛɛna. N kuna no meirekpɛ fɔ kaa hunu. À ga à ŋmɔne Isiraila jama kurum.›»Hirodu na beirekpɛ yom cɛɛ tugu kuna ka ǹ hã cimi-cimi lɔkaci ka handariya-ize di hunutɛrɛ.À na ǹ dɔntɔm Bɛtɛlɛhɛm kpaara ka cii: «Wa kpei hã nda laakali ka simba nda koo di. De wom dià, wa nam ya maa. Hɛɛ mo ya kpei ka à bɛɛrandi.»Ngei mo ka ǹ maa gandakpɛ di sɛ, ǹ kpei. Cɔfɔ handariya-ize ka ǹ di weenuhune hɛrɛ, à go ǹ jine bɛɛnɛ kala à kaa cɛ nungu ka koo di goono.Saa ka ǹ di handariya-ize cɛ, ǹ farihã nda binekaane bambata.Ka ǹ huro fuua kuna, ǹ di koo di nda à nya Mariyama. Ǹ na jɛndɛbiri ka à bɛɛrandi. À banda ǹ na ngei jɛrɔ feeri. Ǹ na à no gomini, wura nda dugubi nda waidi heo kaanɔ ka ǹ cii à sɛ mire.Handiri kuna Ikpɛ na beirekpɛ yom kaabaaru ǹ ma si ye Hirodu dɔ. Ǹ ye ngei laabu nda fɔndɔ ŋmaani fɔ.Saa ka beirekpɛ yom di dira, cɔfɔ Kpe ŋmɔne maleeka fɔ hunutɛrɛ Yosɛfu sɛ handiri kuna. À cii: «Tunu ka koo cɛna di nda à nya zaa ka zuru ndei ka kpei Eziputu laabu. N ma gɔrɔ Eziputu laabu kala ya cii n sɛ, zama Hirodu ba koo di ceeci ka à wi.»Yosɛfu mo tunu, ka koo di nda à nya zaa ciini, ka kpei ndei Eziputu laabu.Nungu di no à goono kala Hirodu bu, zama hɛ ka Kpe cii andebi gaa ma tɔ sɛ. À cii: «A na a koo harubɔrɔ cɛɛ à ma hunu Eziputu laabu».Ka Hirodu bei beirekpɛ yom di na nga zamba, à bine tɔ hali ǹ ci mɔsɔ. Cɔfɔ à na beerem dam ǹ ma koo harubɔrɔ yom kulu ka ǹ goono Bɛtɛlɛhɛm kpaara nda à hundantɛ kulu wi. Ǹ ma koo harubɔrɔ yom wi za jiiri hinka ize me, ka ye ganda nda zanga à lasabu beirekpɛ yom di senda bɔm.Bine, hɛ ka andebi Yeremi cii ma tɔ, ka à cii:«Ǹ maa jinde fɔ Lama kpaara, Bɛrɛɛ nda hẽni nda zalibayom bambata. Lasɛli go hẽ nga koo yom sɛ. À mana baa yamarandiyom, zama à koo yom bu.»Amma ka Hirodu bu, cɔfɔ Kpe ŋmɔne maleeka fɔ hunutɛrɛ Yosɛfu sɛ handiri kuna Eziputu laabu.À cii: «Tunu ka koo di nda à nya zaa, ka kpeindei Isiraila laabu, zama beerem ka ǹ go koo di hundi ceeci, ǹ bu.»Yosɛfu bine tunu ka koo di nda à nya zaa ka kaa Isiraila laabu.Amma ka Yosɛfu maa ǹ cii Akelusu go kpetɛrɛ ŋmaa Yude laabu à baaba Hirodu guribi, à hamburu nga ma kpei nungu di. Ka Ikpɛ na à kaabaaru handiri kuna, à na nga bɔm cendi ka kpei Galile laabu.À kaa gɔrɔ kpaara fɔ ka ǹ cii à sɛ Nazarɛtu. À kaa gɔrɔ Nazarɛtu, zama hɛ ka ǹ cii andebi yom me gaa di ma tɔ sɛ ka ǹ cii: «Ǹ ga à cɛɛ Nazarɛtu bɔrɔ».
target_text: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod, Magi from the east came to Jerusalemand asked, “Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him.”When King Herod heard this he was disturbed, and all Jerusalem with him.When he had called together all the people's chief priests and teachers of the law, he asked them where the Christ was to be born.“In Bethlehem in Judea,” they replied, “for this is what the prophet has written:“ ‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for out of you will come a ruler who will be the shepherd of my people Israel.’ ”Then Herod called the Magi secretly and found out from them the exact time the star had appeared.He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and make a careful search for the child. As soon as you find him, report to me, so that I too may go and worship him.”After they had heard the king, they went on their way, and the star they had seen in the east went ahead of them until it stopped over the place where the child was.When they saw the star, they were overjoyed.On coming to the house, they saw the child with his mother Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures and presented him with gifts of gold and of incense and of myrrh.And having been warned in a dream not to go back to Herod, they returned to their country by another route.When they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. “Get up,” he said, “take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to search for the child to kill him.”So he got up, took the child and his mother during the night and left for Egypt,where he stayed until the death of Herod. And so was fulfilled what the Lord had said through the prophet: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”When Herod realized that he had been outwitted by the Magi, he was furious, and he gave orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem and its vicinity who were two years old and under, in accordance with the time he had learned from the Magi.Then what was said through the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled:“A voice is heard in Ramah, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.”After Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egyptand said, “Get up, take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, for those who were trying to take the child's life are dead.”So he got up, took the child and his mother and went to the land of Israel.But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Having been warned in a dream, he withdrew to the district of Galilee,and he went and lived in a town called Nazareth. So was fulfilled what was said through the prophets: “He will be called a Nazarene.”

input_text: «Bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ hima no zanga hundikpɛ ka à hunu susuba za nda hine ka gbeiteeri yom zinga nga lɛzɛ͂ lambu sɛ.Hundikpɛa nda gbeiteeri yom di saba dinari fɔ banandi bɔm zaari kuna. À banda à na ǹ dam nga lamba kuna.Ka à hunu susuba guuru ɛga zaka, à di bɔrɔ fɔ yom mo go cɛ hebu kuna kɔɔnu. Ǹ si hɛ fɔ kulu tɛ.À cii ngei mo sɛ: ‹Wom mo, wa kpei a lambu. A wom bana hɛ ka à saba.› Ǹ tunu ka kpei.À ye ka hunu zaari bindi nda wiciri guuru hinza zaka kpɛɛnɛ. À ye ka du bɔrɔ fɔ yom ya di.À hunu kpɛɛnɛ wiciri guuru gu kambɛ. À di bɔrɔ fɔ yom ka ǹ go cɛ hebu kuna kɔɔnu. À cii ǹ sɛ: ‹Ifɔ sɛ wom go cɛ hanu kulu, wom si hɛ fɔ kulu tɛ?›Ǹ cii à sɛ: ‹Bɔrɔ fɔ kulu mana i zaa gbei sɛ no.› À cii ǹ sɛ: ‹Wom mo, wa kpei a lambu. Wom du hɛ ka à saba.›Wiciri-kambu ba tɔ. Lambu-kpɛ di cii nga nooru jisikɔ sɛ: ‹Gbeiteeri yom di cɛɛ ka ǹ bana. N ma sinti za kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom di gaa kala sintine bɔrɔ yom gaa.›Saa ka beerem ka ǹ zaa wiciri guuru gu zaka di kaa, afɔ kulu du dinari fɔ banandi.Ka sintine bɔrɔ yom di mo kaa, ǹ tamma ǹ ga ngei bana ka bisa ya di. Amma ngei mo dinari fɔ banandi no bɔrɔ fɔ kulu du.Ka ǹ na ǹ bana ya di, cɔfɔ ǹ go guunu-guunu hundikpɛ di gaa.Ǹ cii: ‹Kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom wɔ guuru fɔ hinne no ǹ na gbei tɛ. Ǹ na ǹ sasabandi nda iyom, iyom ka i na zaari fariga nda à dunguɛ zaa.›Amma hundikpɛa tu ka cii ǹ ŋmɔne afɔ sɛ: ‹A kpaasi, a si ka ilaalɔ tɛ. Dinari fɔ banandi bɔm no i saba. À na ci cimi no ba?N ŋmɔne zaa ka kpei, ni nda kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom wɔ no, a go baa ya bana sara fɔ.À na ci a gunda fɔndɔ ka tɛ hɛ ka a go baa nda a ŋmɔne yom? A ŋmɔne ihinnɔ tɛyom sɛ no, n bine-futu ba?›Ya no kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom kaa ci sintine bɔrɔ yom. Sintine bɔrɔ yom mo kaa ci kɔkɔrɔ banda-bɔrɔ yom. Ǹ go ka iboobo cɛɛ, amma bɔrɔ ka ǹ suuba si ba»Saa ka Yesu go kpei Yerusalɛm wangara, à kpeinda coobaaba-ize wei-cindi-hinka (12) di kambu.À cii ǹ sɛ: «Wa guna, i go ziji Yerusalɛm wangara. Ǹ ga Adam-ize dam garandikɔ jina yom nda Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom kambɛ. Ǹ bine ga à ciiti ka zeeri ka wi.Ǹ ga à dam dimi-cindei kambɛ. Ǹ kaa dondaà ka à bulaala. Ǹ ga à kanji. Jiribi hinzantɛ no à kaa tunu.»Zebede koo yom nya kaa Yesu dɔ nda nga koo yom. À sɔmbu à jine ka à ŋmaarɛ hɛ fɔ.Yesu cii à sɛ: «Ifɔ n go baa?» Wei di cii à sɛ: «N ma tu a koo hinka wɔ sɛ ǹ ma gɔrɔ, afɔ n kambɛŋmaa gaa, afɔ mo n kambɛwo gaa n kpetɛrɛ kuna.»Amma Yesu tu ka cii: «Wom si bei hɛ ka wom go ŋmaarɛ. Gula-ize ka a ba ham, wom hini ka à ham ba? Mirandiyom ka a ba du, wom hini ka duà ba?» Ǹ cii à sɛ: «I hini.»Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Cimi no, wom ga a gula-ize ham. Mirandiyom ka a ba du, wom kaa duà. Amma a kambɛŋmaa nda a kambɛwo gaa gɔrɛ di à mana ci a dɔ no à kaa hunu. Amma beerem ka ǹ sɛ a Baaba na à hinsa, ǹ ŋmɔne no.»Ka coobaaba-ize wei (10) di maa nga di cɔfɔ ǹ bine tɔ cɛlɛ hinka di sɛ.Amma Yesu na ǹ kulu cɛɛ ka cii: «Wom bei ka dimi-cindei hinikpɛ yom go ka ngei dabari cɛbɛ dimi-cindei bɔm. Gaabikooni yom mo go ka ngei dabari cɛbɛ ǹ bɔm.Amma à si ci ya di wom game. Bɔrɔ kulu ka à go baa nga ma ci ibeeri wom kuna, akpɛ ma ci wom gbeiteeri.Bɔrɔ kulu ka à go baa nga ma ci jina wom kuna kala akpɛ ma ci wom sɛ tam.Ya no Adam-ize mana kaa bɔrɔ ma tamtɛrɛ à sɛ. Amma à kaa no ka tamtɛrɛ ka nga hundi no beerem sɛ. À kaa no ka ci fansa hɛ jama guribi.»Saa ka Yesu go hunu Yeriko kpaara, jama bakara na à gana.Cɔfɔ danam hinka fɔ mo go gɔrɔ fɔnda hanga gaa. Ǹ maa ǹ cii Yesu go bisa. Cɔfɔ ǹ kuuwa ka cii: «E Kpe, ni Dafidi ize, n ma suuji cɛbɛ i sɛ.»Jama di deeni ǹ gaa ka cii ǹ ma dɛnjɛ. Amma ǹ go kuuwa nda gaabi ka tɔntɔnu. Ǹ cii: «E Kpe, ni Dafidi ize, n ma suuji cɛbɛ i sɛ.»Yesu cɛ ka ǹ cɛɛ. À cii: «Ifɔ no wom go baa ya tɛ wom sɛ?»Ǹ cii à sɛ: «Kpe i go baa no i moo yom wɔ ma feeri.»Sisibi na Yesu dii. À na ǹ moo yom haama. Maasa-maasa ǹ tɛ moo. Ǹ na Yesu gana.
target_text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire men to work in his vineyard.He agreed to pay them a denarius for the day and sent them into his vineyard.“About the third hour he went out and saw others standing in the marketplace doing nothing.He told them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard, and I will pay you whatever is right.’So they went. “He went out again about the sixth hour and the ninth hour and did the same thing.About the eleventh hour he went out and found still others standing around. He asked them, ‘Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?’“ ‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered. “He said to them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard.’“When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last ones hired and going on to the first.’“The workers who were hired about the eleventh hour came and each received a denarius.So when those came who were hired first, they expected to receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.When they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner.‘These men who were hired last worked only one hour,’ they said, ‘and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the work and the heat of the day.’“But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am not being unfair to you. Didn't you agree to work for a denarius?Take your pay and go. I want to give the man who was hired last the same as I gave you.Don't I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?’“So the last will be first, and the first will be last.”Now as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside and said to them,“We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to deathand will turn him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. On the third day he will be raised to life!”Then the mother of Zebedee's sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him.“What is it you want?” he asked. She said, “Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.”“You don't know what you are asking,” Jesus said to them. “Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?” “We can,” they answered.Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink from my cup, but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.”When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.Jesus called them together and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,and whoever wants to be first must be your slave–just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”As Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.Two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was going by, they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.“Lord,” they answered, “we want our sight.”Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.
new_anglais: “The first day of the Sabbath and sat by the elders of the elders and went out to meet the other to be born.When he had been born from the elders, he was a man to be called his disciples and sat on the law.The disciples came to the priests and sat on the law.The temple of the temple of heaven is written.The Son came to him, “for I have left that the Son of God?

input_text: Saa ka ǹ maani Yerusalɛm wangara, ǹ tɔ Betafaji kpaara tondi-kuuku fɔ dɔ ka ǹ cii à sɛ Olibe zugu. Yesu na coobaaba-ize hinka dɔntɔm.À cii ǹ sɛ: «Wom ma kpei kpaara wɔ ka à goono wom jine. Za wom tɔ, wom kaa di farika-nya fɔ ka à goono hɔantɛ nda binci haruwasu fɔ. Wom ma ǹ feeri ka kaandei a sɛ.De bɔrɔ fɔ na hɛ fɔ cii wom sɛ, wom ma cii: ‹Kpe ya gunda ǹ muraadu.› À ga ǹ yeeti akpɛ sɛ nda waasi.»Nga di kulu tɛ zama hɛ ka andebi cii ma tɔ sɛ. À cii:«Wa cii Siyɔ͂ koo hundiyo sɛ: ‹Guna, n gandakpɛ go kaa n dɔ. Bɔrɔ baanɔ no. À goono farika-nya bɔm, Farika-binci haruwasu bɔm, Waatom farika-nya ize bɔm.› »Coobaaba-ize yom di kpei kpaara di. Ǹ tɛ zanga Yesu na ǹ no fɔndɔ ǹ ma tɛ.Ǹ kaanda farika-nya di nda binci haruwasu di ka ngei jiine yom dɛcɛ ǹ bɔm, Yesu kaaru ǹ bɔm.Jama di kuna bɔrɔ boobo go ka ngei jiine yom daaru fɔnda bɔm. Afɔ yom mo go dabina-nya kambɛ pati ko ka ǹ daaru fɔnda bɔm.Jama mo goono jine ko kpei. Jama goono à banda mo. Ǹ kulu go kuuwa ko cii: «Ozaana Dafidi Ize! Barika-kpɛ no Bɔrɔ ka à go kaa Kpe maa gaa. Ozaana, Ikpɛ ka à goono bɛɛnɛ hali samawu.»Ka à go huro Yerusalɛm, wangara di kulu laakali tunu ka cii: «Mee no bɔrɔ-kpɛ?»Jama bakara go cii: «Yesu wɔ andebi no, wɔ ka à hunu Nazarɛtu kpaara Galile laabu.»Yesu huro Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ. À na neerakɔ yom nda deikɔ yom gaarɛ ǹ ma hunu Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ. À na nooru barimekɔ yom tabulu yom nda guutu neerakɔ yom cita yom hangasandi.À cii ǹ sɛ: «Sendi-Hantumantɛ go cii: ‹Ǹ ga a gɔrɛ-dɔ cɛɛ no aduwa tɛyom dɔ›. ‹Amma wom wɔ, wom na à tɛ ze laalɔ yom lɔkɔ.›»Sumbarikɔ yom nda danam yom kaa Yesu dɔ Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ. À na ǹ kulu no baani.Amma garandikɔ jina yom nda Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom di maamaaci yom ka à tɛ. Ǹ maa koo yom mo ka ǹ go jinde zaa Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ ko cii: «Ozaana Dafidi Ize!» À gaa no, ǹ binetɔ.Ǹ cii Yesu sɛ: «N go maa hɛ ka koo yom wɔ go cii ba?» Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Oò, a go maa. Wom na wɔne coo ba? ‹Koo cɛna yom nda naanandi yom me gaa no, N na sifayom gɔrɛndi n bɔm sɛ.›?»Cɔfɔ Yesu na ǹ nam ka hunu wangara di kuna. À kpei Betani kpaara ka kani noodi.Susuba ka à go ye wangara di kuna à maa hɛrɛɛ.Cɔfɔ à di jee-nya fɔ fɔnda jɛrɛ gaa. À kpei à dɔ, amma à mana di hɛ fɔ kulu à gaa kala kɔɔsu. Cɔfɔ à cii à sɛ: «Ize ba afɔ ma si tɛ n gaa pai.» Maasa-maasa jee-nya di kɔɔgu.Maamaaci na coobaaba-ize yom dii. Ǹ cii: «Mɛtɛ maasa-maasa jee-nya di kɔɔgu da?»Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Cimi no, a go cii wom sɛ, de wom gunda naane, wom si sikka mo, à na ci hɛ ka à tɛ jee-nya wɔ sɛ hinne no wom kaa tɛ. Amma ba wom bumbum, de wom cii tondi-kuuku wɔ sɛ: ‹Gana ka kam buula wɔ kuna›, dom à kaa tɛ.Hɛ kulu mo ka wom go ŋmaarɛ aduwa kuna, de wom go naane, wom kaa duà.»Yesu huro Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ. Saa ka à go cooandi garandikɔ jina yom nda jama harikusu yom kaa à dɔ. Ǹ na à hã: «Hini fɔ no n go hɛ yom wɔ tɛ ndaà? Mee ya na n no hini wɔ?»Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Hɛɛ mo, a wom hã hɛ fɔ. De wom na à cii a sɛ, hɛɛ mo ya cii wom sɛ hini ka a go hɛ yom wɔ tɛ ndaà.Mirandiyoma ka Yohana tɛ, mani no à hunu, Ikpɛ dɔ no dee wala adam-ize yom dɔ no?» Cɔfɔ ǹ sendi cɛrɛ game ka cii: «De i cii: ‹Ikpɛ dɔ no à hunu›, à kaa cii i sɛ: ‹Ya di gaa, ifɔ sɛ no wom mana à naane?›Amma de i cii: ‹Adam-ize yom dɔ no à hunu›, jama wɔ no i go hamburu, zama ǹ kulu tabai Yohana ya andebi no.»Ǹ tu Yesu sɛ ka cii: «I si bei.» Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Ya no hɛɛ mo, a si cii wom sɛ hini ka a go hɛ yom di tɛ ndaà.»«Amma mɛtɛ no wɔne hima wom sɛ? Bɔrɔ fɔ ya gunda koo harubɔrɔ hinka. À kaa sintina dɔ ka cii à sɛ: ‹A koo, hunkuna n ma kpei gbei tɛ a lɛzɛ͂ lambu kuna.›Koo di tu à sɛ ka cii: ‹A si kpei.› Amma à banda, ka à tuubi, à kpei.Baaba kaa ihinkantɛ di mo dɔ. À cii nga mo sɛ ya di. Koo di mo tu à sɛ ka cii: ‹To, Kpe.› Amma à mana kpei.Ǹ bɔrɔ hinka di kuna, mee ya na baaba di bine-baa tɛ?» Ǹ cii à sɛ: «Sintine bɔrɔ di.» Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, alikaasi takɔ yom nda weikuuru yom go wom jina Ikpɛ kpetɛra kuna.Yohana kaa no wom dɔ cɛyom-suusu fɔndɔ kuna. Wom mana naane à gaa. Amma alikaasi takɔ yom nda weikuuru yom na naane dam à gaa. Wom mo, ka wom di nga di, nda à kulu wom mana tuubi ka naane à gaa.»«Wa maa yaase wɔne mo kpɛɛnɛ. Hundikpɛ fɔ ya goono ka à na lɛzɛ͂ lambu tilam. À na ǹ kaka. À na guusu fɔ fansi lɛzɛ͂-hari kankamyom sɛ. À na tanda fɔ mo tɛ. À na lamba dam harifari yom kambɛ ka naaru. À kpei laabu ŋmaani.Saa ka tuuri-ize kɔsuyom waatɛ tɔ, à na nga banyã yom dɔntɔm harifari yom di dɔ ǹ ma nga lɛzɛ͂-ize yom zaa.Harifari yom di na à banyã yom di dii. Ǹ na afɔ bulaala. Ǹ na afɔ wi. Ǹ na afɔ mo cetu-cetu nda tondi yom.Hundikpɛa ye ka banyã fɔ yom mo dɔntɔm ka ǹ ba ka bisa sintine ŋmɔne yom di. Harifari yom di tɛ ngei mo sɛ ya di.Amma kɔkɔrɔ banda, à na nga koo dɔntɔm ǹ dɔ ka cii: ‹Ǹ kaa bɛɛrɛ tɛ a koo sɛ.›Amma ka harifarei di koo di, ǹ cii cɛrɛ sɛ: ‹Bɔrɔ wɔne ya ci tubukɔa. Wa kaa i ma à wi. Tuba ma ci i ŋmɔne.›Cɔfɔ ǹ na à dii ka cetu lamba banda ka à wi.To. Saa ka lambu kpɛa kaa, ifɔ no à kaa tɛ harifari yom di sɛ?»Beerem cii à sɛ: «À ma wiyom futu tɛ bɔrɔ laalɔ yom wɔ sɛ ka harifari teji yom zaa nga lamba sɛ. Beerem wɔ ga à tuuri-ize yom kɔsu ka à no à sɛ saa ka ǹ nini.»Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Sendi-Hantumantɛ yom cii: ‹Tondi ka fuu cinikɔ yom hungu, Nga ya ci mimbari cire tondi sintine. Za Kpe dɔ no wɔne hunu. À tɛ maamaaci mo i moo yom sɛ. Wom na nga di coo ba?›À sɛ no, a go cii wom sɛ ka Ikpɛ kpetɛrɛ wɔ, ǹ ga à ganandi wom gaa ka à no dimi fɔ sɛ ka à kaa gbei tɛ nda zanga à hima.Bɔrɔ kulu ka à kam tondi wɔ bɔm, akpɛ tutubu no. Amma bɔrɔ ka à bɔm tonda kam mo, tonda ga akpɛ fufu no.»Saa ka garandikɔ jina yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom maa yaase yom di, ǹ go bei ngei gaa no à go sendi.Ǹ go ceeci ngei ma à dii amma ǹ go hamburu jama, zama beerem go tabai Yesu ya andebi no.
target_text: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,saying to them, “Go to the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt by her. Untie them and bring them to me.If anyone says anything to you, tell him that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away.”This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:“Say to the Daughter of Zion, ‘See, your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’ ”The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.They brought the donkey and the colt, placed their cloaks on them, and Jesus sat on them.A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed shouted, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Hosanna in the highest!”When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, “Who is this?”The crowds answered, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves.“It is written,” he said to them, “ ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a ‘den of robbers.’ ”The blind and the lame came to him at the temple, and he healed them.But when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things he did and the children shouting in the temple area, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were indignant.“Do you hear what these children are saying?” they asked him. “Yes,” replied Jesus, “have you never read, “ ‘From the lips of children and infants you have ordained praise’?”And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.Early in the morning, as he was on his way back to the city, he was hungry.Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. Then he said to it, “May you never bear fruit again!” Immediately the tree withered.When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?” they asked.Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only can you do what was done to the fig tree, but also you can say to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and it will be done.If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.”Jesus entered the temple courts, and, while he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you this authority?”Jesus replied, “I will also ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.John's baptism–where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or from men?” They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn't you believe him?’But if we say, ‘From men’–we are afraid of the people, for they all hold that John was a prophet.”So they answered Jesus, “We don't know.” Then he said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.“What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’“ ‘I will not,’ he answered, but later he changed his mind and went.“Then the father went to the other son and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I will, sir,’ but he did not go.“Which of the two did what his father wanted?” “The first,” they answered. Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.For John came to you to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.“Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and went away on a journey.When the harvest time approached, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.“The tenants seized his servants; they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.Then he sent other servants to them, more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.Last of all, he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.“But when the tenants saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him and take his inheritance.’So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.“Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”“He will bring those wretches to a wretched end,” they replied, “and he will rent the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time.”Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone; the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?“Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard Jesus' parables, they knew he was talking about them.They looked for a way to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowd because the people held that he was a prophet.

input_text: Yesu tu ǹ sɛ nda yaase yom kpɛɛnɛ.À cii: «Bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ hima mo zanga gandakpɛ fɔ ka à go hiije tɛ nga koo sɛ.À na nga banyã yom dɔntɔm ǹ ma kpei beerem cɛɛ ǹ ma kaa hiije di dɔ amma beerem hungu ka kaa.À na banyã fɔ yom mo dɔntɔm kpɛɛnɛ ka cii: ‹Wa cii beerem ka a na ǹ cɛɛ di sɛ: "Guna, a na ŋmaari tɛ. A na hɔu yeeji yom nda memunu naasɔ yom wi. À na hɛ kulu sɔɔlu kɔ. Wa kaa hiija dɔ."›Amma ngei wɔ mana à dam hɛ fɔ. Ǹ na ngei kpeiyom tɛ. Afɔ kpei nga fari. Afɔ mo kpei nga tenku.Afɔ yom mo na banyã yom dii ka ǹ woo. Ǹ na ǹ wi.Ka gandakpɛ di maa nga di, cɔfɔ à bine tɔ hali à futu. À na nga wangaari yom dɔntɔm. Ǹ na bɔrɔ-wikɔ yom di wi ka ǹ wangara di kulu tɔnu.Bine à cii nga banyã yom sɛ: ‹Hiija sɔɔlu kube amma beerem ka a na ǹ cɛɛ, ǹ mana ci tɔantɛ yom.Nga di sɛ, wa kpei dɛbɛ yom bɔm, bɔrɔ kulu ka wom di wom ma à cɛɛ hiija dɔ.›Banyã yom di hunu ka kpei dɛbɛ yom bɔm. Ǹ na beerem kulu ka ǹ di cɛɛ ka meigu za ilaalɔ yom hali ihinnɔ yom. Hiije fuua tɔ nda bɔrɔ.Gandakpɛa huro ka guna beerem ka ǹ go ŋmaa. À di bɔrɔ fɔ nungu di ka à mana hiije jiine dam.Cɔfɔ à cii à sɛ: ‹Kpaasi, mɛtɛ n tɛ ka huro nee, n sinda hiije jiine?› Amma bɔrɔ di mana me feeri ka sendi.Gandakpɛ di cii gbeiteeri yom di sɛ: ‹Wa à hɔ cee nda kambɛ ka zaa. Wa à cetu tɛrɛ kube kuna. Nungu di no hẽni nda hinje kaamayom goono.›Ǹ go ka iboobo cɛɛ amma bɔrɔ ka ǹ suuba si ba.»Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom kpei saawara ka ngei ma Yesu hiiri à sendi yom gaa.Ǹ na ngei coobaaba-ize yom nda Hirodu banda-bɔrɔ yom dɔntɔm à dɔ ka cii: «Coobaaba, i bei ka ni ya ci cimikpɛ. N go beerem cooandi Ikpɛ fɔnda bɔm nda cimi. N sinda baa-baa. N si adam-ize yom takari guna.Nga di sɛ, cii i sɛ hɛ ka à hima n sɛ. À halali bɔrɔ ma alikaasi bana Kaisa sɛ ba wala à mana halali?»Za ka Yesu bei hanyafute ka ǹ gunda, à cii: «Ifɔ sɛ no wom go ka a bubure, munafici yom?Wa a cɛbɛ anzerefu wɔkɔkɔ-ize fɔ ka ǹ cini alikaasi bana ndaà di.» Ǹ kaanda à sɛ dinari fɔ ka à cɛbɛ.Cɔfɔ à cii ǹ sɛ: «Mee himai nda mee hantum no ǹ tɛ nooru wɔ gaa?»Ǹ cii à sɛ: «Kaisa ŋmɔne no.» Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Nga di sɛ, wa Kaisa hɛ yom no Kaisa sɛ. Wa Ikpɛ hɛ yom mo no Ikpɛ sɛ.»Ka ǹ maa ya di, cɔfɔ maamaaci na ǹ dii. Ǹ na Yesu nam ka dira.Hanu nga di no, Sadusi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom ka ǹ go cii bukɔei tunandiyom si, ǹ kaa Yesu dɔ. Ǹ na à hã ka cii:«Coobaaba, Moisi cii de bɔrɔ fɔ ka à mana du hɛiyom bu, à cɛɛnɛ ma à wɛndɛ hiiji ka hɛi ndaà, bukɔa sɛ.Cɛɛnɛ nda bɛɛrɛ iye goono i kuna. Sintina hiiji. À bu, à mana hɛi. À na nga wɛnda nam nga cɛɛnɛ sɛ.Ihinkantɛ di nda ihinzantɛ mo tɛ ya di kala iyeantɛ gaa.Ǹ kulu banda, weibɔrɔ di mo bu.Bukɔei tunandiyom hine, bɔrɔ iye di kuna, mee wɛndɛ no, zama ǹ kulu na à zaa wɛndɛ?»Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Wom go dɛrɛ fa ka wom si faham nda Sendi-Hantumantɛ yom nda Ikpɛ dabari.Bukɔei tunandiyom hine, ǹ si hiiji, ǹ si hiijandi. Amma beerem bo goono zanga Ikpɛ maleeka yom ka ǹ goono bɛɛnɛ kuna.Amma ka simba nda bukɔei tunandiyom, Ikpɛ cii:‹Hɛɛ wɔ, Hɛɛ ya ci n cɛɛ yom ŋmɔne Ikpɛ, Aburɛma ŋmɔne Ikpɛ, Izaaki ŋmɔne Ikpɛ, Yakɔbu ŋmɔne Ikpɛ.› Wom na nga di coo ba? Ikpɛ mana ci bukɔei ŋmɔne Ikpɛ amma bahuna yom ŋmɔne no.»Ka jama di maa nga di, maamaaci na ǹ dii nda à cɛbɛ yom di.Amma ka Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom mo maa Yesu na Sadusi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom me hɔ, ǹ meigu dɔ fɔ.Ǹ kuna afɔ ka à ci Moisi Fɔnda beikɔ fɔ na à hã ka bubure.À cii: «Coobaaba, wɔ fɔ ya ci meire bambata Moisi Fɔnda kuna?»Yesu cii à sɛ: « ‹N ma baa Kpe, n ŋmɔne Ikpɛ nda n bine kulu nda n hundi kulu nda n lasabu kulu.›Nga di ya meire beeri. Nga di mo ya ci meire sintine.Ihinkantɛ mo hima meire di ka à cii: ‹N ma baa n gɔrɔkasine zanga n bɔm.›Meire hinka wɔ gaa no, Moisi Fɔnda kulu nda Andebi yom sendi yom kulu go kɔtɔ.»Amma za Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom go meigu, Yesu na ǹ hã ka cii:«Ifɔ no Mɛsiya hima wom sɛ? Mee ize no?» Ǹ cii à sɛ: «Dafidi ize no.»Yesu mo cii ǹ sɛ: «Mɛtɛ no Dafidi na à cɛɛ Kpe, Biya Halaala kuna ka cii:‹Kpe cii a Kpea sɛ: "N ma gɔrɔ a kambɛŋmaa gaa Hali ya n ŋmɔne ibɛrɛ yom tɛ n cee yom dɛcɛyom dɔ."›De Dafidi go ka à cɛɛ Kpe, mɛtɛ à tɛ ka ci à Ize?»Ba bɔrɔ fɔ mana hini ka tu à sɛ ba sendi kpɛsɛ fɔ. Za hanu nga di mo no bɔrɔ kulu hamburu nda à hãyom.
target_text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:“The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.He sent his servants to those who had been invited to the banquet to tell them to come, but they refused to come.“Then he sent some more servants and said, ‘Tell those who have been invited that I have prepared my dinner: My oxen and fattened cattle have been butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’“But they paid no attention and went off–one to his field, another to his business.The rest seized his servants, mistreated them and killed them.The king was enraged. He sent his army and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.“Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those I invited did not deserve to come.Go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.’So the servants went out into the streets and gathered all the people they could find, both good and bad, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.“But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.‘Friend,’ he asked, ‘how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ The man was speechless.“Then the king told the attendants, ‘Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’“For many are invited, but few are chosen.”Then the Pharisees went out and laid plans to trap him in his words.They sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know you are a man of integrity and that you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You aren't swayed by men, because you pay no attention to who they are.Tell us then, what is your opinion? Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”But Jesus, knowing their evil intent, said, “You hypocrites, why are you trying to trap me?Show me the coin used for paying the tax.” They brought him a denarius,and he asked them, “Whose portrait is this? And whose inscription?”“Caesar's,” they replied. Then he said to them, “Give to Caesar what is Caesar's, and to God what is God's.”When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.That same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.“Teacher,” they said, “Moses told us that if a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and have children for him.Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.The same thing happened to the second and third brother, right on down to the seventh.Finally, the woman died.Now then, at the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the seven, since all of them were married to her?”Jesus replied, “You are in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.At the resurrection people will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.But about the resurrection of the dead–have you not read what God said to you,‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together.One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question:“Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?”Jesus replied: “ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’This is the first and greatest commandment.And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,“What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” “The son of David,” they replied.He said to them, “How is it then that David, speaking by the Spirit, calls him ‘Lord’? For he says,“ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’If then David calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”No one could say a word in reply, and from that day on no one dared to ask him any more questions.
new_anglais: Jesus said to the first day: “Beer to the elders of the people and the elders of the Sabbath.The disciples came to him and sat down to the people.He sent two disciples to be seen by them to the poor.The disciples went to the seed.“Then he was a

input_text: Yesu sendi jama di sɛ nda nga coobaaba-ize yom sɛ ka cii:«Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom go gɔrɔ Moisi nungu kuna.Nga di sɛ, hɛ yom kulu ka ǹ cii wom sɛ, wa ǹ jɛ ka ǹ tɛ. Amma wa si tɛ nda zanga ǹ tɛgbei yom goono nda, zama ngei wɔ go cii no amma ǹ si ka à tɛ.Ǹ go jɛrɔ timɔ hɔ ka à zaayom gaabu ka dɛcɛ beerem jɛsɛ bɔm. Amma ǹ si ba ka ngei kambɛ-ize fɔ dam ka jɛrɔa zinji.Ǹ go ka ngei gbei yom kulu tɛ no beerem ma di sɛ. Ǹ go tira-ize beeri yom ka aya yom goono ǹ kuna dam. Ǹ go ka ngei kpɛ hanga taalam hɛandi ka tɔntɔnu.Jine gɔrɛ-dɔ bɛɛrɛkpɛ no ǹ go baa jingaru ŋmaayom dɔ. Ǹ go baa jine gɔrɛ-dɔ bɛɛrɛkpɛ Yuifu yom mariga-fuu yom kuna.Ǹ go baa mo no beerem ma cini ka ngei fɔɔ hebu batuma yom kuna. Ǹ go baa mo beerem ma ngei cɛɛ Coobaaba, Coobaaba.Amma wom wɔ, wom ma si tu ǹ ma wom cɛɛ «coobaaba», zama bɔrɔ fɔlɔnku hinne ya ci wom Coobaaba, nga ya ci Mɛsiya. Wom wɔ, wom kulu nya-ize yom no.Wom ma si bɔrɔ fɔ kulu cɛɛ «baaba» ganda wɔ bɔm, zama bɔrɔ fɔlɔnku hinne ya ci wom Baaba. Nga ya ci wɔ ka à goono bɛɛnɛ.Wom ma si tu mo ǹ ma cii wom sɛ cɛbɛkɔ yom, zama bɔrɔ fɔlɔnku hinne ya ci wom cɛbɛkɔ, nga ya ci Mɛsiya.Amma wom kuna bɔrɔ kulu ka à beeri ka bisa wom kulu, nga ya kaa ci wom gbeiteeri.Bɔrɔ kulu ka à na nga bɔm bɛɛrandi ǹ ga à yeeti ganda. Bɔrɔ kulu mo ka à go ka nga bɔm-yeeti-ganda, ǹ ga à bɛɛrandi.Amma kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, munafici yom. Wom go bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ daabu beerem sɛ. Wom si huro wom bumbum, wom si nam beerem ka ǹ ba huro mo sɛ ǹ ma huro.Kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, munafici yom. Wom go sokooni yom haribarika yom ŋmaa. Wom go ka aduwa kuuku tɛ wom ma hima zanga ganakɔ hinnɔ yom. Nga di sɛ no, ǹ kaa wom ciiti ka jaasa ǹ kulu.Kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, wom munafici yom. Wom go tɛɛku nda ganda yaali ka du ba bɔrɔ fɔlɔnku ka bɛrɛ. Saa ka akpɛ bɛrɛ, wom go ka à tɛ Gehɛnna ize ce hinka ka bisa wom.Kaito wom, danam yom ka ǹ go danam yom cendi. Wom go cii: ‹Bɔrɔ kulu ka à ze nda Ikpɛ fuu beeri, à na ci hɛ fɔ. Amma bɔrɔ kulu ka à ze nda Ikpɛ fuu beeri di wura, à ze di ga à dii.›Saamu yom nda danam yom no wom bara. Ǹ kuna wɔ fɔ ya beeri nda afɔ, wura no de wala Ikpɛ fuu beeri ka à go wura di halaalandi no?Wom go cii: ‹Bɔrɔ kulu ka à ze nda garandi banda-tanda, à na ci hɛ fɔ. Amma bɔrɔ kulu ka à ze nda saraa ka à goono banda-tanda bɔm, à ze di ga à dii.›Saamu yom nda danam yom no wom bara. Ǹ kuna wɔ fɔ ya beeri nda afɔ, hɛ ka à gaa ǹ saraa no dee, wala banda-tanda no ka à go saraa halaalandi?Nga di sɛ, bɔrɔ ka à ze nda garandi banda-tanda, akpɛ ze nda hɛ kulu ka à goono à bɔm mo.Bɔrɔ ka à ze nda Ikpɛ fuu beeri, akpɛ ze nda wɔ ka à go gɔrɔ à kuna mo.Bɔrɔ ka à ze nda bɛɛnɛ mo à go ze nda Ikpɛ kpetɛrɛ-kariga noya nda wɔ ka à go gɔrɔ à bɔm.Kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, munafici yom. Wom go nugu-nugu nda musooro nda yaazi yom zakaa. Amma wom go fɔnda ŋmɔne hɛ beeri yom nam zanga cɛyom-suusu nda suuji nda naane. Nge yom ya hima wom ma tɛ dom, amma wom ma si zakaa di mo nam.Wom danam yom ka wom go danam yom cendi, wom go filifiliwa sɔgu ka yoo gonu.Kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, munafici yom. Wom go gula-ize nda combu banda hinnandi, amma ǹ kuna go tɔ nda zeetɛrɛ nda bɔm hiniyom zame.Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ, danam ka n go ci, n ma gula-ize di nda combu di kuna nyunu jina, à banda mo ma hinne.Kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, munafici yom. Wom hima no zanga saarɛ yom ka ǹ kpaarandi. Ǹ go boori moo gaa, amma ǹ kuna, ǹ tɔ nda bukɔ biri yom nda ziibi dimi kulu.Ya no wom mo, moo gaa wom go hima beerem sɛ bɔrɔ yom ka ǹ cɛsuusu, amma kuna-kuna wom tɔ nda munaficitɛrɛ nda fɔnda hunguyom.Kaito wom, Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, munafici yom. Wom go andebi yom saarɛ yom cini. Wom go bɔrɔ cɛantɛ-suusu yom saarɛ yom taalam.Wom go cii: ‹De i goono i cɛɛ yom waatɛ dom, i si meigu ndei ka andebi yom kuri bambari.›Zanga ya wom go sɛɛda wom bɔm noya ka wom ya ci beerem ka ǹ na andebi yom wi ize yom.Wom go wom cɛɛ yom bata tɔɔnandi.Gondi yom, gazama ize yom no wom bara. Mɛtɛ wom tɛ ka kɔma Gehɛnna ciiti kuna?À sɛ no, guna hɛɛ wɔ a go andebi yom nda mariga harikusu yom nda Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom dɔntɔm wom dɔ. Wom bine ga afɔ yom wi ka ǹ kanji. Afɔ yom mo wom ga ǹ bulaala wom mariga-fuu yom kuna. Wom ga ǹ guruguzandi wangara nda wangara yom kuna.À sɛ no, bɔrɔ cɛantɛ-suusu kuri kulu ka à munu ganda wɔ bɔm à banandi ma kam wom bɔm. Kuri wɔ ka à munu hunu za Abɛli ka à ci bɔrɔ cɛantɛ-suusu gaa, kala Zakari Barakiyu koo ka wom wi Ikpɛ fuu beeri nda garandi banda-tanda game.Cimi no, a go cii wom sɛ, hɛ nge yom di kulu kaa kam zamaani wɔ bɔm.E Yerusalɛm, Yerusalɛm, ni ka n go andebi yom wi ka beerem ka Ikpɛ dɔntɔm n dɔ cetu nda tondi. Ce mɛijɛ no a go baa ya n koo yom meigu zanga gɔrɔngɔ-nya cini ka nga ize yom meigu nga fata yom cire. Amma wom mana tu.Guna, ǹ na wom fuu nam kɔnu.A go cii wom sɛ, wom si di hɛɛ kpɛɛnɛ za maasa kala wom ma cii: ‹Barika-kpɛ no wɔ ka à go kaa Kpe maa gaa.›»
target_text: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:“The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.So you must obey them and do everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.They tie up heavy loads and put them on men's shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.“Everything they do is done for men to see: They make their phylacteries wide and the tassels on their garments long;they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues;they love to be greeted in the marketplaces and to have men call them ‘Rabbi.’“But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have only one Master and you are all brothers.And do not call anyone on earth ‘father,’ for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.Nor are you to be called ‘teacher,’ for you have one Teacher, the Christ.The greatest among you will be your servant.For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.“Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the kingdom of heaven in men's faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let those enter who are trying to.“Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel over land and sea to win a single convert, and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as you are.“Woe to you, blind guides! You say, ‘If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gold of the temple, he is bound by his oath.’You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?You also say, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gift on it, he is bound by his oath.’You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?Therefore, he who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.And he who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.And he who swears by heaven swears by God's throne and by the one who sits on it.“Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices–mint, dill and cummin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law–justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.“Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.“Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of dead men's bones and everything unclean.In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.“Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our forefathers, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.Fill up, then, the measure of the sin of your forefathers!“You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?Therefore I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.I tell you the truth, all this will come upon this generation.“O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing.Look, your house is left to you desolate.For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”

input_text: Yesu bine hunu Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ. Cɔfɔ à coobaaba-ize yom maani à dɔ ka à cɛbɛ Ikpɛ bɛɛrandiyom dɔ cinari yom.Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Wom go di hɛ yom wɔ kulu ba? Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, ba tondi fɔ si cindi tondi bɔm ka ǹ si à karu ka see.»Saa ka Yesu go gɔrɔ Olibe zugu tondi-kuukua bɔm, coobaaba-ize yom di kaa à dɔ kambu. Ǹ cii: «Cii i sɛ saa ka hɛ yom di kaa tɛ. Alaamu fɔ mo ya tɛ n kaayom gaa, nda zamaani beenantɛ?»Cɔfɔ Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Wom ma laakali bɔrɔ fɔ kulu ma si wom dɛrandi.Bɔrɔ boobo go kaa nda a maa ka cii: ‹Hɛɛ ya ci Mɛsiya.› Ǹ bine kaa bɔrɔ boobo dɛrandi.Wom kaa maa wangu yom baaru nda wangu yom kɔsɔngu. Wom laakali ma si tunu. Tilasi no nge yom di ma tɛ amma beeniyom mana tɔ jina.Dimi kaa tunu ka gaaba nda dimi. Kpetɛrɛ yom kaa tunu kpetɛrɛ gaa. Hɛrɛɛ nda balau kaa tɛ. Ganda zinji yom kaa tɛ nungu ŋmaani-ŋmaani.Hɛ nge yom di kulu bɔnɛi sintiyom no.À banda ǹ kaa wom dam kambɛ ka wom bɔnandi. Ǹ kaa wom wi. Handunya dimi kulu mo kaa hungu wom a maa sabu sɛ.Bɔrɔ boobo kaa dɛrɛ. Ǹ kaa cɛrɛ dam kambɛ ka hungu ngei cɛrɛ nda cɛrɛ.Andebi tangari-tangari boobo kaa tunu ka bɔrɔ boobo dɛrandi.Fɔnda hunguyom kaa tɛ ka ba. Bɔrɔ boobo baakasine kaa ye nda banda.Amma bɔrɔ ka à go hini suuru kala me, à kaa du faaba.Ǹ kaa Baaru Hinnɔ fɛɛ Ikpɛ kpetɛra bɔm handunya kulu, à ma tɛ sɛɛda dimi-cindei kulu sɛ. Cɔfɔ beeniyom ma kaa.Andebi Daniyɛli sendi ka simba nda fɛntɛ hɛ ka à mallaka tɛ. Wom kaa di à go cɛ Nungu-halaala kuna. Bɔrɔ ka à go coo, à ma faham fa!Saa ka à go cɛ Nungu-halaala kuna beerem ka ǹ goono Yude laabu ma zuru ka kpei tondi-kuuku yom bɔm.Bɔrɔ ka à goono fuu bɛɛnɛ bɔm, à ma si zumbu ka huro nga fuu kuna ka hɛ fɔ zaa.Bɔrɔ ka à goono fari mo ma si ye banda ka nga kpɛ zaa.Amma kaito weibɔrɔ yom ka ǹ gunda kunu nda weibɔrɔ yom ka ǹ go naanandi hanu nge yom di.Wom ma ŋmaarɛ wom zure ma si tɛ harigu waatɛ wala Saaba hine.Guruguze bambata kaa tɛ ka à mana tɛ za handunya sintiyom hali ka kaa maasa. Nga di banda à dimi si tɛ kpɛɛnɛ pai.De bine ǹ si hanu nge yom di dunguriandi, bahuna ba afɔ si kaa du faaba. Amma suubantɛ yom sabu sɛ ǹ kaa hanu nge yom di dunguriandi.Bine, ba de bɔrɔ fɔ go cii wom sɛ: ‹Guna, Mɛsiya go nee› wala ‹Guna à go yɔngɔ› wa si à naane.Mɛsiya tangari-tangari yom nda andebi tangari-tangari yom kaa tunu. Ǹ ga alaamu bambata yom nda maamaaci yom cɛbɛ hali de à hini ka tɛ, ǹ kaa ba suubantɛ yom dɛrandi.Guna, a jina ka cii wom sɛ kɔ.Nga di sɛ, de ǹ go cii wom sɛ: ‹Guna, à goono ganji kuna›, wa si hunu. Wala ǹ go cii: ‹Guna, à goono fuu yom kpɛsɛndi yom kuna›, wa si à naane.Zanga bɛɛnɛ cini tɛ nyalau za weenuhune ka kpei weenukane, ya no Adam-ize mo kaayom kaa bara.Nungu ka jifa goono, nungu di no yobereku yom cini meigu.Hanu nge yom di taabi futa banda, Maasa-maasa weenu kaa ye kube. Handu si nga kaari no. Handariya-ize yom kaa kam za bɛɛnɛ. Bɛɛnɛ dabari yom kaa zinji.À gaa no Adam-ize ŋmɔne alaamu kaa hunu bɛɛnɛ kuna. Ganda kunda yom kulu mo kaa wuuru. Ǹ kaa di Adam-ize go kaa bɛɛnɛ buru yom bɔm nda dabari bambata nda deiza.Saa di gaa à ga nga maleeka yom samba nda kaakaaji funsuyom beeri. Ǹ ga a ŋmɔne suubantɛ yom meigu za handunya cɛnjɛ taaci kulu gaa kala bɛɛnɛ, za à me neehɛrɛ kala à me yahɛrɛ.Amma wom ma dendeni yaase ka jee-nya di go wom no. Saa ka à kambɛ cɛna yom baani à go kɔsu teji fiyo, wom go bei kɛdiya go maani.Ya no wom mo, saa ka wom go di hɛ nge yom di kulu, wom ma bei ka Adam-ize go maani, à goono gambu me gaa.Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, zamaani wɔne si beeni pai kala de hɛ nge yom di kulu ma tɛ.Bɛɛnɛ nda ganda kaa beeni amma a sendi yom si beeni pai.»«Amma hanu nga di nda à lɔkaci ba bɔrɔ fɔ si à bei, ba bɛɛnɛ maleeka yom. A Baaba nga fɔlɔnku go ka à bei.Amma zanga à tɛ Nowe hanu yom gaa di, ya no Adam-ize mo kaayom gaa.Zanga za tunfaana hari mana kaa beerem go ŋmaa, ǹ go ham, ǹ go hiiji, ǹ go hiijandi kala hanu ka Nowe huro hari-hia kuna.Ǹ mana hɛ fɔ kulu dam saalu kala tunfaana hari di na ǹ jirisi ka kaa ka ǹ kulu ŋmaa. Zanga ya no Adam-ize mo kaayom gaa.Lɔkaci nga di harubɔrɔ hinka kaa goono fari. Ǹ ga afɔ zaa ka afɔ nam.Weibɔrɔ hinka kaa fufu tondi gaa. Ǹ ga afɔ zaa ka afɔ nam.Nga di sɛ, wom mo batu, zama wom si bei lɔkaci ka à gaa wom Kpe go kaa.Amma wom ma wɔne bei ka de hundikpɛ bei saa ka zee go kaa, à ga à batu. À si nam à ma nga fuu funu.À sɛ no, wom mo wa sɔɔlu, zama lɔkaci ka à gaa wom si tamma, à gaa no Adam-ize go kaa.Mee ya ci tam naanekpɛ, laakalantɛ ka à kpe na à jisi ka nga fuu tam yom kulu dam à kambɛ à ma ǹ no ǹ ŋmaari lɔkaci ka à hima?Binekaane-kpɛ no, tam nga di ka saa ka à kpe go kaa, à ga à garu à mo tɛ ya di.Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, à ga nga haribarika kulu dam à kambɛ.Amma de tam laalɔ wɔ go cii nga bine kuna: A kpe wɔ si kaa tamba.Cɔfɔ à mo ka nga kpaasi tam yom karu. À mo ŋmaa ko ham nda baji-wi yom.Tam nga di, à kpea go kaa no hanu ka à si batu, lɔkaci ka à si bei.Kpea ga à koronga ka à pati-pati, ka à tɛ afɔ nda munafici yom. Nungu di no hẽni nda hinje kaamayom goono.»
target_text: Jesus left the temple and was walking away when his disciples came up to him to call his attention to its buildings.“Do you see all these things?” he asked. “I tell you the truth, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately. “Tell us,” they said, “when will this happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”Jesus answered: “Watch out that no one deceives you.For many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am the Christ, ’ and will deceive many.You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but see to it that you are not alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.All these are the beginning of birth pains.“Then you will be handed over to be persecuted and put to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.At that time many will turn away from the faith and will betray and hate each other,and many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.Because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold,but he who stands firm to the end will be saved.And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.“So when you see standing in the holy place ‘the abomination that causes desolation,’ spoken of through the prophet Daniel–let the reader understand–then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.Let no one on the roof of his house go down to take anything out of the house.Let no one in the field go back to get his cloak.How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now–and never to be equaled again.If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘There he is!’ do not believe it.For false Christs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and miracles to deceive even the elect–if that were possible.See, I have told you ahead of time.“So if anyone tells you, ‘There he is, out in the desert,’ do not go out; or, ‘Here he is, in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.“Immediately after the distress of those days “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’“At that time the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and all the nations of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky, with power and great glory.And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.“Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.Even so, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, right at the door.I tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.“No one knows about that day or hour, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.“Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.“Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.I tell you the truth, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.But suppose that servant is wicked and says to himself, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
