input_text: «Wom ma si ciiti, zama ǹ ma si wom ciiti sɛ.Wom ma si à tɛ, zama ǹ kaa wom ciiti no nda ciitiyom dimi ka wom go ciiti. Ǹ kaa wom neesi nda neesiji ka wom go neesi nda.Ifɔ sɛ n go di subu-ize ka à goono n nya-ize moo kuna, amma n si di bundu ka à goono n bumbum moo kuna?Wala mɛtɛ n tɛ ka cii n nya-ize di sɛ: ‹Cɛ, ya subu-ize wɔ kaa n sɛ, ka à goono n moo kuna?› E, bundu no n sɛ moo kuna ya fa!Munafici, bundu wɔ kaa n moo kuna jina. À gaa no n di ihinnɔ ka subu-ize di ka à goono n nya-ize moo kuna kaa.Wom ma si hɛ halaala no hansi yom sɛ. Wom ma si wom kɔlibɛ caadantɛ yom cetu kpisɔ͂ yom jine. N ma si nga di tɛ, zama haniba ǹ ga ǹ taamu. Hansi yom ma si ye ka wom nama ka pati-pati.»«Wo ŋmaarɛ, ǹ kaa wom no. Wo ceeci, wom kaa du. Wo kobi, ǹ kaa feeri wom sɛ.Bɔrɔ kulu ka à go ŋmaarɛ, ǹ ga à no. Bɔrɔ ka à go ceeci mo, à kaa du. Bɔrɔ ka à go kobi mo, ǹ kaa feeri à sɛ.Wom kuna mee ya ga nga koo no tondi, de à na à ŋmaarɛ buuru?Wala de à na à ŋmaarɛ ciifi, à ga à no gondi?Bine, wom ka wom ci bɔrɔ laalɔ yom, wom ŋmaani ka hɛ hinnɔ yom no wom koo yom sɛ. Ya mo no wom Baaba ka à goono bɛɛnɛ, à go hɛ hinnɔ yom no beerem sɛ ka ǹ go ka à ŋmaarɛ.Nga di sɛ, hɛ kulu ka wom go baa beerem ma tɛ wom sɛ, ya no wa à tɛ ngei mo sɛ, zama Moisi Fɔnda nda Andebi yom tira yom mo go ka nga di cii.»«Wa huro nda me kankamantɛ. Me hɛantɛ nda fɔndɔ bambata ya kpei halaciyom dɔ. Bɔrɔ bayom ya huro ndaà.Amma me kankamanta nda fɔndɔ mariyo ya kpei hundi dɔ. Bɔrɔ fɔ-fɔ ya duà.»«Wom ma laakali mo nda andebi tangari-tangari yom, ka ǹ go feeji kuuru yom dam zanga jiine ka kaa wom dɔ, amma sagali yom no kuna-kuna ka ǹ go kɔm.Wom kaa ka ǹ bei ǹ tɛgbei yom gaa. Beerem si lɛzɛ͂-ize kaa kariji-nya gaa. Ǹ si jee kaa dɛnfɛnɛ kariji-nya gaa mo. À na ci cimi no ba?Zanga ya no tuuri-nya hinnɔ kulu go ka ize hinnɔ hɛi. Amma tuuri-nya laalɔ mo go ka ize laalɔ hɛi.Tuuri-nya hinnɔ si hini ka ize laalɔ hɛi. Ya no tuuri-nya laalɔ mo si hini ka ize hinnɔ hɛi.Tuuri-nya kulu ka à si ize hinnɔ hɛi, ǹ go ka à dumbu no. Ǹ ga à cetu nini kuna mo.Zanga ya no, wom ga ǹ bei ǹ tɛgbei yom gaa.À na ci beerem kulu ka ǹ go cii a sɛ: ‹Kpe, Kpe› ya kaa huro bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ kuna. Amma beerem ka ǹ go ka a Baaba, ka à goono bɛɛnɛ kuna bine-baa tɛ, ngei ya huro.Bɔrɔ boobo kaa cii a sɛ hanu nga di: ‹Kpe, Kpe i na andebitɛrɛ tɛ n maa gaa. I na hɔllɛ yom gaarɛ n maa gaa. I na dabari gbei boobo tɛ n maa gaa. À na ci cimi no ba?›Cɔfɔ hɛɛ mo, ya cii ǹ sɛ: ‹A si wom bei pai. Wa gana a sɛ, wom ka wom hungu fɔnda.› »«Nga di sɛ, bɔrɔ kulu ka à go maa a sendi wɔne yom, ka ǹ dam nga tɛgbei kuna, a ga à himandi no zanga laakalantɛ ka à na nga fuu cini tondi bɔm.Hari kam, gooru yom tɔ hali ǹ munu kala-kala. Heo tɛ, à na fuu di karu. Amma fuua mana kam, zama tondi bɔm no ǹ na à sinji.Bɔrɔ kulu mo ka à maa a sendi wɔne yom, ka à mana ǹ dam nga tɛgbei kuna, a ga à himandi no zanga bɔmsi-kpɛ. À na nga fuu cini taasi bɔm.Hari kam, gooru yom tɔ hali ǹ munu kala-kala. Heo tɛ, à na fuu di karu. Fuua kam. À kulu kam duru-duru.»À kaa tɔ ka Yesu na nga mecine wɔne yom beeni, jama di go maamaaci nda à cɛbɛ.Ǹ go maamaaci, zama à go ka ǹ cooandi no zanga à gunda hini. À mana cooandi zanga Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ yom.
target_text: “Do not judge, or you too will be judged.For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged, and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.“Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when all the time there is a plank in your own eye?You hypocrite, first take the plank out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.“Do not give dogs what is sacred; do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they may trample them under their feet, and then turn and tear you to pieces.“Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.For everyone who asks receives; he who seeks finds; and to him who knocks, the door will be opened.“Which of you, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?Or if he asks for a fish, will give him a snake?If you, then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!So in everything, do to others what you would have them do to you, for this sums up the Law and the Prophets.“Enter through the narrow gate. For wide is the gate and broad is the road that leads to destruction, and many enter through it.But small is the gate and narrow the road that leads to life, and only a few find it.“Watch out for false prophets. They come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ferocious wolves.By their fruit you will recognize them. Do people pick grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?Likewise every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit.A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot bear good fruit.Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.Thus, by their fruit you will recognize them.“Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and in your name drive out demons and perform many miracles?’Then I will tell them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers!’“Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock.The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall, because it had its foundation on the rock.But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell with a great crash.”When Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,because he taught as one who had authority, and not as their teachers of the law.

input_text: Saa ka Yesu zumbu za tondi-kuukua bɔm, bɔrɔ bakara na à gana.Cɔfɔ, jire fɔ maani à dɔ ka sɔmbu à jine. À cii: «Kpe, de n baa n hini ka a hinnandi.»Yesu na kambɛ sɛllɛ ka à haama. À cii: «A go baa, n ma hinne.» Maasa-maasa à hinne à jiretɛrɛ di gaa.Yesu cii à sɛ: «N ma laakali, n ma si à cii bɔrɔ fɔ kulu sɛ, amma n ma kpei ka n bɔm cɛbɛ garandikɔ sɛ. N ma saraa ka Moisi Fɔnda cii tɛ, à ma du ka tɛ ǹ sɛ sɛɛda.»Ka Yesu kpei Kapɛnahum kpaara, wangu-ize yom jinehune fɔ maani à dɔ. À ŋmaarɛ ka cii à sɛ:«Kpe, a gbei-ize fɔ go kani fuu nda gaaham buyom futu. À go taabi kala-kala.»Cɔfɔ Yesu cii à sɛ: «A go kaa, ka à no baani.»Wangu-ize yom jinehune di tu à sɛ ka cii: «Kpe, ya na tɔ ka n ma huro a fuu kuna. N ma sendi fɔlɔnku hinne cii, a gbei-ize di kaa du baani.Hɛɛ mo, wangu-ize fɔ hini cire no a goono. Wangu-ize yom mo goono a cire. De a cii afɔ sɛ: ‹Kpei›, à kpei. De a cii afɔ mo sɛ: ‹Kaa›, à kaa. De a cii a banyã mo sɛ: ‹Tɛ wɔ›, à tɛ.»Ka Yesu maa nga di, maamaaci na à dii. Cɔfɔ à cii beerem ka ǹ go ka à gana sɛ: «Cimi no a go cii wom sɛ, ba Isiraila kuna, ya na di naane beeri ya wɔ.A go cii wom sɛ mo, ka bɔrɔ boobo go kaa za weenuhune hɛrɛ nda weenukane hɛrɛ. Ǹ kaa gɔrɔ nda Aburɛma nda Izaaki nda Yakɔbu bɛɛnɛ kpetɛrɛ kuna.Amma kpetɛrɛ ize yom tɛrɛ kube kuna no ǹ ga ǹ cetu. Nungu di no hẽni nda hinje kaamayom goono.»Yesu cii wangu-ize yom jinehune sɛ: «Kpei, à ma tɛ n sɛ zanga n naane.» Lɔkaci nga di gaa no, gbei-ize di du baani.À banda, Yesu kaa huro Piɛɛ fuu. À di Piɛɛ hanzure weibɔrɔ go kani nda gaawaase.À na à kambɛ haama. À gaawaase di bisa à gaa. Cɔfɔ à tunu ka ǹ yaarɛ.Ka wiciri-kambu tɔ, ǹ kaanda hɔllɛkpɛ boobo Yesu sɛ. À na hɔllɛ yom di gaarɛ nda nga me sendi fɔ. Beerem mo kulu ka ǹ sinda baani, à na ǹ no baani.Nga di tɛ no, zama hɛ ka ǹ cii andebi Esayi me gaa ma tɔ sɛ. Esayi cii: «Nga bumbum na i hinabunutɛrɛ zaa, Ka i doori yom jɛrɛ.»Ka Yesu di bɔrɔ bakara na nga dam bindi, à na fɔndɔ no ngei ma kpei yahɛrɛ tɛrɛ.Cɔfɔ Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ fɔ maani à dɔ ka cii à sɛ: «Coobaaba, a ga n gana nungu kulu ka n go kpei.»Yesu cii à sɛ: «Kaabi yom gunda guusu yom. Bɛɛnɛ ciro yom mo gunda gɔrɛ-dɔ. Amma Adam-ize sinda nungu ka à ma nga bɔm-dɛcɛ.»À coobaaba-ize yom kuna afɔ cii à sɛ: «Kpe, tu a sɛ jina ya kpei ka a baaba fiji.»Amma Yesu tu à sɛ ka cii: «A gana. Nam bukɔ yom ma ngei bukɔ yom fiji.»Ka Yesu huro hari-hi, à coobaaba-ize yom dɛcɛ à banda.Cɔfɔ heo beeri fɔ tunu buula bɔm, kala hari boosu yom go hari-hia kaaru, ka à daabu. Amma Yesu wɔ go jiibi.Coobaaba-ize yom di maani ka à tunandi. Ǹ cii: «Kpe, i faaba. I go halaci.»À cii ǹ sɛ: «Ifɔ sɛ wom go hamburu, wom naane cɛnakpɛ yom?» À tunu ka deeni heo di nda buula di gaa. Cɔfɔ nungu tɛ sakai.Coobaaba-ize yom maamaaci ka cii: «Mee dimi no bɔrɔ wɔ, hali ba heo nda buula mo go ka à sendi gana?»Ka à tɔ yahɛrɛ tɛrɛ, Gadarancei laabu hɔllɛkpɛ hinka fɔ hunu saarɛ yom kuna ka à kube. Ǹ futu kala-kala hali bɔrɔ fɔ kulu si hini ka fɔndɔ nga di gana.Ǹ go kuuwa ka cii: «Ifɔ ya goono ni nda iyom game, Yesu Ikpɛ Ize? N kaa ka i bɔnandi no ba, za lɔkaci mana tɔ?»Hali ǹ moorantɛ, kpisɔ͂ gaa bambata fɔ goono ka à go kurum.Hɔllɛ yom di go Yesu ŋmaarɛ ka cii: «De n na i gaarɛ, n ma nam i ma kpei huro kpisɔ͂ gaa wɔ kuna.»À cii ǹ sɛ: «Wa kpei.» Ǹ hunu ka kpei huro kpisɔ͂ gaa di kuna. Cɔfɔ kpisɔ͂ gaa di kulu go pitto ko gungure, za tondi bɔm ka kam buula di kuna. Ǹ bu hari kuna.Ǹ kurukɔ yom zuru ka kpei kpaara. Ǹ deede hɛ kulu ka à tɛ, nda hɛ ka à tɛ hɔllɛkpɛ yom di sɛ.Cɔfɔ kpaara di kulu hunu ka kaa Yesu kube. Za ǹ dià, ǹ go ka à ŋmaarɛ, ka cii à ma hunu ngei laabu kuna.
target_text: When he came down from the mountainside, large crowds followed him.A man with leprosy came and knelt before him and said, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!” Immediately he was cured of his leprosy.Then Jesus said to him, “See that you don't tell anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.“Lord,” he said, “my servant lies at home paralyzed and in terrible suffering.”Jesus said to him, “I will go and heal him.”The centurion replied, “Lord, I do not deserve to have you come under my roof. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed.For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and that one, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”When Jesus heard this, he was astonished and said to those following him, “I tell you the truth, I have not found anyone in Israel with such great faith.I say to you that many will come from the east and the west, and will take their places at the feast with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.But the subjects of the kingdom will be thrown outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go! It will be done just as you believed it would.” And his servant was healed at that very hour.When Jesus came into Peter's house, he saw Peter's mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.He touched her hand and the fever left her, and she got up and began to wait on him.When evening came, many who were demon-possessed were brought to him, and he drove out the spirits with a word and healed all the sick.This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah: “He took up our infirmities and carried our diseases.”When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”Jesus replied, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”Another disciple said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”Then he got into the boat and his disciples followed him.Without warning, a furious storm came up on the lake, so that the waves swept over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.The disciples went and woke him, saying, “Lord, save us! We're going to drown!”He replied, “You of little faith, why are you so afraid?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the waves, and it was completely calm.The men were amazed and asked, “What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!”When he arrived at the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.“What do you want with us, Son of God?” they shouted. “Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?”Some distance from them a large herd of pigs was feeding.The demons begged Jesus, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”He said to them, “Go!” So they came out and went into the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and died in the water.Those tending the pigs ran off, went into the town and reported all this, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they pleaded with him to leave their region.

input_text: Ka Yesu ye ka huro hari-hi, à na buula dem ka kpei nga kpaara.Cɔfɔ ǹ kaanda à sɛ mɔngɔlɔ fɔ daari bɔm. Ka Yesu di naane ka ǹ gunda, à cii mɔngɔlɔ di sɛ: «A koo, n laakali ma kani. A na n yaafa nda n dulum yom.»Moisi Fɔnda cooandikɔ fɔ yom cii ngei bine kuna: «Bɔrɔ wɔ go ka Ikpɛ sendi yaamu, ka à cɛnandi.»Za ka Yesu go ka ǹ lasabu yom bei, à cii ǹ sɛ: «Ifɔ sɛ wom go hɛ laalɔ lasabu wom bine kuna?Wɔ fɔ ya faala ka bisa, bɔrɔ ma cii a na n yaafa nda n dulum yom, wala bɔrɔ ma cii tunu ka dira?Bine, wom ma bei ka Adam-ize gunda hini ganda bɔm, ka dulum yom yaafa.» À sɛ no Yesu go sendi mɔngɔlɔ wɔ sɛ: «Tunu ka n daari zaa ka kpei fuu.»Cɔfɔ à tunu ka kpei fuu.Ka jama di nga di, maamaaci na ǹ dii. Ǹ na Ikpɛ saabu, zama à na hini wɔne no adam-ize yom sɛ.Saa ka Yesu bisa nungu di ka tɔ jine, à di bɔrɔ fɔ mo ka à maa Matiyu. À go gɔrɔ baalici alikaasi tayom dɔ. Yesu cii à sɛ: «A gana.» À tunu ka à gana.À kaa tɔ Yesu go gɔrɔ ka ŋmaa fuu kuna. Cɔfɔ alikaasi takɔ boobo, nda dulumkooni boobo, kaa ko ŋmaa nda Yesu nda à coobaaba-ize yom.Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom dià. Ǹ cii à coobaaba-ize yom sɛ: «Ifɔ sɛ no wom Coobaaba go ŋmaa nda alikaasi takɔ yom wɔ nda dulumkooni yom wɔ?»Amma ka Yesu maa nga di, à cii ǹ sɛ: «Beerem ka ǹ gunda baani, ǹ si baa lokotoro, kala beerem ka ǹ sinda baani.Amma wa kpei dendeni hɛ ka wɔne cii: ‹Hɛɛ wɔ, suuji no a go baa, à na ci garandi›. Ya na kaa bɔrɔ cɛantɛ-suusu yom cɛɛ ǹ ma tuubi, amma dulumkooni yom.»Yohana coobaaba-ize yom bine kaa à dɔ. Ǹ cii: «Ifɔ sɛ no iyom wɔ nda Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom, i cini mehɔ zaa, amma n coobaaba-ize yom si mehɔ zaa?»Yesu tu ǹ sɛ ka cii: «Haruhiiji kpaasi yom bine yom si hini ka sara, saa ka haruhiiji goono ndei. Amma hanu yom kaa, ka ǹ ma haruhiiji ganandi ǹ dɔ. Saa di no ǹ kaa mehɔ zaa.Bɔrɔ si zaara teji dumbari dam kpɛ zeenɔ gaa, zama dumbari di, à ga izeena jɛrɛ fɔ zaa no. Pati di kaa tɔntɔnu.Ya no, beerem si dufɛ͂ teji dam hamburu zeenɔ yom kuna, zama hamburu yom di bɔgu no. Dufɛ͂ di kaa bambari. Hamburu yom mo kaa sara. Amma ǹ go dufɛ͂ teji dam hamburu teji kuna. Ǹ kulu mo kaima.»Saa ka Yesu go hɛ nge yom di cii ǹ sɛ, cɔfɔ Yuifu yom mariga jina fɔ maani à dɔ, ka sɔmbu à jine. À cii: «A koo hundiyo bu maasa-maasa. Amma kaa ka n kambɛ dɛcɛ à bɔm, à kaa huna.»Yesu tunu ka à gana. Ya no à coobaaba-ize yom mo.Weibɔrɔ fɔ mo goono, ka kuri go dooru à sɛ hali jiiri wei-cindi-hinka (12). À maani à gaa banda-banda, ka à kpɛ hanga haama.À go cii nga bine kuna: «De a na à kpɛ hanga hinne haama, a du baani.»Amma Yesu bɛrɛ ka dià. À cii à sɛ: «A koo hundiyo, n laakali ma kani. N naane na n no baani.» Weibɔrɔ di du baani za saa nga di.Ka Yesu kaa Yuifu yom mariga jina di hundi, à di gasiakari yom nda jama fɔ mo ka ǹ go kɔsɔngu.À cii ǹ sɛ: «Wa wom bɔm cendi, zama koo hundiyo di mana bu. À go jiibi no.» Cɔfɔ ǹ go Yesu haaru.Amma saa ka à na jama di kaa tɛrɛ, à huro ka hundiya kambɛ di. Koo hundiyo di tunu.Baaru nga di kpei laabu di nungu kulu.Ka Yesu bisa nungu di ka tɔ jina, danam hinka fɔ na à gana. Ǹ go kuuwa ka cii: «Ni, Dafidi ize, n ma suuji cɛbɛ i sɛ.»Saa ka Yesu tɔ fuu kuna, danam yom di maani à dɔ. Yesu cii ǹ sɛ: «Wom naane ka a hini ka hɛ wɔ tɛ?» Ǹ tu à sɛ: «Oò Kpe.»Cɔfɔ à na ǹ moo yom haama ka cii: «À ma tɛ wom sɛ nda zanga wom naane goono nda.»Ǹ moo yom feeri. Yesu na ǹ kaabaaru ka cii: «Wa laakali ka si nam bɔrɔ fɔ kulu ma bei.»Amma ka ǹ dira ǹ na à maa fɛɛ laabu di nungu kulu.Ka ǹ go hunu, cɔfɔ beerem kaanda Yesu sɛ bɛbɛ hɔllɛkpɛ fɔ.Ka à na hɔllɛ di gaarɛ, bɛbɛ di go sendi. Maamaaci na jama dii. Ǹ cii: «Hɛ wɔ dimi mana tɛ Isiraila kuna ba ce fɔ.»Amma Farisi fɔndɔ bɔrɔ yom cii: «À go hɔllɛ yom gaarɛ no nda hɔllɛ yom kpe.»Yesu bine go wangara yom kulu nda kpaara yom kulu yaali ko cooandi ǹ mariga-fuu yom kuna. À go kpetɛrɛ Baaru Hinnɔ fɛɛ. À go doorikɔm kulu, nda leebantɛ kulu no baani jama kuna.Ka à di jama bakara di, sisibi na à dii ǹ sɛ, zama fariga goono ǹ gaa. Ǹ karu ka see mo zanga feeji yom ka ǹ sinda kurukɔ.Bine, à cii nga coobaaba-ize yom sɛ: «Fari-wiyom ba gumo, amma gbeiteeri yom mana ba.Nga di sɛ, wa hɛimaru Kpe ŋmaarɛ, à ma gbeiteeri yom samba nga hɛimaru kuna.»
target_text: Jesus stepped into a boat, crossed over and came to his own town.Some men brought to him a paralytic, lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Take heart, son; your sins are forgiven.”At this, some of the teachers of the law said to themselves, “This fellow is blaspheming!”Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why do you entertain evil thoughts in your hearts?Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins....” Then he said to the paralytic, “Get up, take your mat and go home.”And the man got up and went home.When the crowd saw this, they were filled with awe; and they praised God, who had given such authority to men.As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector's booth. “Follow me,” he told him, and Matthew got up and followed him.While Jesus was having dinner at Matthew's house, many tax collectors and “sinners” came and ate with him and his disciples.When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and ‘sinners’?”On hearing this, Jesus said, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, not sacrifice.’ For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”Then John's disciples came and asked him, “How is it that we and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”Jesus answered, “How can the guests of the bridegroom mourn while he is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; then they will fast.“No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for the patch will pull away from the garment, making the tear worse.Neither do men pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the skins will burst, the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”While he was saying this, a ruler came and knelt before him and said, “My daughter has just died. But come and put your hand on her, and she will live.”Jesus got up and went with him, and so did his disciples.Just then a woman who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak.She said to herself, “If I only touch his cloak, I will be healed.”Jesus turned and saw her. “Take heart, daughter,” he said, “your faith has healed you.” And the woman was healed from that moment.When Jesus entered the ruler's house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd,he said, “Go away. The girl is not dead but asleep.” But they laughed at him.After the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took the girl by the hand, and she got up.News of this spread through all that region.As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”When he had gone indoors, the blind men came to him, and he asked them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” “Yes, Lord,” they replied.Then he touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith will it be done to you”;and their sight was restored. Jesus warned them sternly, “See that no one knows about this.”But they went out and spread the news about him all over that region.While they were going out, a man who was demon-possessed and could not talk was brought to Jesus.And when the demon was driven out, the man who had been mute spoke. The crowd was amazed and said, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”But the Pharisees said, “It is by the prince of demons that he drives out demons.”Jesus went through all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and sickness.When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few.Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.”
